Junajted zove Ralfa Rangnika, čoveka koji je Lajpcigu gurnuo u kasu pola milijarde evra
Jednim okom gledaju Partizan, drugim traže direktora...

07 Nov 2019

Predstavnici Mančester Junajteda imali su dug sastanak sa Ralfom Rangnikom, iskusnim nemačkim stručnjakom, kako bi navodno opipali njegov puls i saznali kakvi su izgledi da prihvati ponudu za posao na Old Trafordu. Kako piše The Athletic Đavoli bi 61-godišnjeg stručnjaka rado videli na poziciji tehničkog direktora, koji bi za osnovni zadatak imao regrutovanje mladih igrača širom sveta.
Kao kandidati za tu poziciju prethodnih dana pominjana su imena Edvina van der Sara i Rija Ferdinanda, ali samo rezultati iz poslednjeg kluba gde je radio - RB Lajpcig - klasifikuju Rangnika kao velikog favorita u toj trci.
Emil Forsberg, Lukas Klosterman, Marcel Zabicer, Jusuf Poulsen, Jozua Kimih, Marcel Halstenberg, Nabi Keita, Timo Verner, Dajot Upamekano, Ibrahima Konate...samo su neka od imena koja je za, manje više mali novac, Rangnik doveo u Lajpcig. Računajući i one koji su otišli, poput Keite, svi oni zajedno danas vrede više od POLA MILIJARDE EVRA. 
Ralf Rangnik prethodnih dana pominjao se kao mogući naslednik Nika Kovača na klupi Bajerna, ali kako su Bavarci, sva je prilika izabrali Arsena Vengera, Mančester Junajtedu otvara se velika šansa.
Prekaljeni fudbalski radnik prokomentarisao je interesovanje Engleza, ne potvrdivši da je već obavljena prva runda pregovora..."Srećan sam tamo gde jesam", počeo je Rangnik, koji je i dalje zaposlen u Red Bulu kao neka vrsta koordinatora za sportska pitanja u svim franšizama. "Ali ako bilo koji klub želi da razgovara sa mnom, trebalo bi prvo da postavi pitanje: da li bih mogao da budem neko ko utiče na područje razvoja čitavog kluba? Ako nije tako, dobili bi samo polovinu onoga za šta sam sposoban".
Rangnik je dijagnostifikovao prvi problem Junajteda..."Uvek je teško pratiti put nekoga kao što je Aleks Ferguson, koji je toliko dugo bio uspešan. A to je još teže ako često menjate trenere. Svakom promenom menja se identitet i to se odražava na sportski razvoj. Ako pogledate novac koji je uložen poslednjih pet godina u tim, može se reći da je učinak slab", zaključio je Rangnik.
text:
United calls Ralf Rangnik, the man who pushed half a billion euros in cash to Leipzig
With one eye looking at Partizan, the other looking for a director ...

07 Nov 2019

Manchester United representatives had a long meeting with Ralph Rangnik, an experienced German expert, to allegedly feel his pulse and find out the prospect of accepting a job offer at Old Traford. According to The Athletic, the Devils would love to see a 61-year-old expert as a technical director, who would have recruited young players around the world as their primary task.
The names of Edwin van der Sara and Rio Ferdinand were mentioned as candidates for the position in the previous days, but only results from the last club he worked for - RB Leipzig - classify Rangnik as a big favorite in that race.
Emil Forsberg, Lukas Klosterman, Marcel Zabicer, Yusuf Poulsen, Joshua Kimih, Marcel Halstenberg, Nabi Keita, Timo Werner, Dajot Upamekano, Ibrahim Konate ... are just some of the names that, for less money, brought Ranknik to Leipzig . Counting those who left, like Keita, all together are worth more than HALF BILLION today.
Ralf Ranknik has been mentioned in previous days as a possible successor to Nick Kovac on the Bayern bench, but since the Bavarians have chosen Arsene Wenger with every opportunity, Manchester United have a great chance.
The overworked football worker commented on the Englishman's interest, not confirming that the first round of negotiations had already been completed ... "I'm happy where I am," began Rangnik, who is still employed by Red Bull as a sort of sports coordinator in all franchises . "But if any club wants to talk to me, they should ask the question first: could I be someone who affects the development area of the whole club? If not, they would only get half of what I'm capable of."
Ranking diagnosed United's first problem ... "It's always difficult to follow the path of someone like Alex Ferguson, who has been so successful for a long time. And it's even harder if you change coaches often. Every change changes your identity and reflects on sports. If you look at the money that has been invested in the last five years in these teams, it can be said that the performance is poor, "concluded Rangnik.
